doc.field: Arch window and Colosseum wall detail. From the gallery on the upper level of the Colosseum. Part of a walking tour we did on our own using a couple of guide books from home. November 27, 2011
italy rome sports construction ancient december roman ruin historic colosseum arena gladiator collosseum romeitaly 2011

Just after we entered into the Colosseum. We were using a Roma Pass, available for 25 euros, which gives free admission to two attractions, reduced admission to others, and free use of Rome's subways, buses, and light rail system. Best of all, the Roma Pass also has priority admission to all attractions. We were in the Colosseum in less than 2 minutes, as opposed to a hour and a half wait for those buying the tickets on the spot. The Roma Pass is a bargain. Part of a walking tour we did on our own using a couple of guide books from home. November 27, 2011

On Sundays, the street along the northern wall of the Colosseum is closed to vehicular traffic. People take over the street and make a day of it hanging around the Colosseum area. Food and souvenir carts are also plentiful. Here we have just come out of the subway and are looking toward the Temple of Venus and Rome. Part of a walking tour we did on our own using a couple of guide books from home. November 27, 2011
